author: wired blogs
text: date: fri, 15 oct 1999 15:55:19 -0400 from: "ntwoc" (ntwoc@home.com)to: newsfeedback@wired.comsubject: a shot in the arm!!!this is in reference to "microsoft lambastes linux," 08.oct.99. now that microsoft has officially recognized linux as a competitor, maybe both camps will get the os(s) that they desire. i say this because microsoft will go after linux in one way or another, causing the linux community to retaliate. the outcome of this conflict should be two robust and viable operating systems that can do as the end user desires and requires. they will both be user friendly and workstation configurable.in the end, microsoft will lose simply because its prices and itsover inflated kernel(s) won't be able to compete with the speed atwhich upgrades, improvements, and innovations by linux/unix/open source communities will be implemented.
